div.p: NARRATOR: There are a number of situations when zero is the only low-risk choice. For example, a person is under 21 has a legal mandate for abstaining.
NARRATOR: Orâ€”in most cases, policies mandate abstaining at work or in public places.
NARRATOR: Zero is also the only low-risk choice for people who have health problems such as addiction, liver disease, or neurological problems, and for people who are taking certain medications.
NARRATOR: Women with increased risk for breast cancer might also want to consider drinking infrequently or not drinking at all.
NARRATOR: While the amount of alcohol shown to increase risk for breast cancer varies from study to study,
the research fairly consistently indicates that women with other risk factors for breast cancer might further increase their risk by drinking as little as one to two drinks per day.
NARRATOR: Research also indicates that zero is the only recommended low-risk choice for women who are pregnant, who are currently planning to get pregnant, or who are breast-feeding.
